poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Loose and stiff, his fingers
Neither grip nor lowse
The lute's throat or the louts'
At play in the close. 
He loops a rope and lowps
But it lets him down,
It lets him go. He looks
Around him. Yes! The wood louse
Or slater, there's a thing: such armour
Yet it loots such worthless junk.
